name: places/ChIJE7n4PK1ZwokROhNAlpwG70w
formattedAddress: Inside of Fabric House, 257 W 39th St Storefront #4, New York, NY 10018, USA
adrFormatAddress: Inside of Fabric House, 257 W 39th St Storefront #4, New York, NY 10018, USA

originalText.text: Their price was not transparent when they asked me to drop off my cloth. When I realized that the price was too high and called them to cancel my service, they haven’t started working on my cloth, yet. However when I picked up my clothes, they already cut it and forced me to pay the price.  I would avoid going there the second time.

text.text: Their price was not transparent when they asked me to drop off my cloth. When I realized that the price was too high and called them to cancel my service, they haven’t started working on my cloth, yet. However when I picked up my clothes, they already cut it and forced me to pay the price.  I would avoid going there the second time.

originalText.text:
These guys are miracle workers!
I brought two vintage t-shirts to them in hopes of making both into tank tops and the results were perfect! Alessandro took the time to really listen to what I wanted and was clear about what was doable and what was not.
I am very happy with the end result: my shirts are just what I had in mind.

Prices are very reasonable and the turn-around time is quick too.
I cannot recommend highly enough!!
They will be my go-to for any tailoring needs now.

A heartfelt 'thank you' to Alessandro and his team for taking such care in their work, and realizing my vision!!

originalText.text: Thank you so much Alessandro and team for taking my old sari and turning it into a beautiful top & skirt set. It wasn’t the easiest ask but you did it perfectly and with such quick turnaround. Here is a picture of us from the Indian-American wedding we attended, where I wore the top and skirt.

text.text: Thank you so much Alessandro and team for taking my old sari and turning it into a beautiful top & skirt set. It wasn’t the easiest ask but you did it perfectly and with such quick turnaround. Here is a picture of us from the Indian-American wedding we attended, where I wore the top and skirt.

originalText.text: I called first and spoke to Alessandro about a simple dress alteration. We made an appointment, I went to the shop (which is a little tricky to find), but when I finally arrived, the people upstairs (main level) directed me to the basement, where the shop is, and I met Alessandro right away. He had me put the dress on, did a quick alteration pin-up, and then I picked the dress up the next day. Very happy with my dress alteration! Thank you Alessandro and team!

text.text: I called first and spoke to Alessandro about a simple dress alteration. We made an appointment, I went to the shop (which is a little tricky to find), but when I finally arrived, the people upstairs (main level) directed me to the basement, where the shop is, and I met Alessandro right away. He had me put the dress on, did a quick alteration pin-up, and then I picked the dress up the next day. Very happy with my dress alteration! Thank you Alessandro and team!

originalText.text:
Working with Alessandro and Maria was an absolute honor and pleasure. Not only were they able to provide an exquisite fit for my bridal gown, they also altered garments for nearly my entire wedding party. Their craftsmanship resonated in every stitch from the custom made flower-girl dresses, tailored groomsman suit for my brother, and adjusted bridesmaids dresses. Alessandro and Maria are absolute professionals and were great supporters throughout the chaotic period.
After choosing my husband, About the Stitch, is the second best choice I have ever made. I am so grateful they were able to be a part of my special day.
